doc.after: On 27Â or 28Â November, the crew sighted Jamaica at a distance of 27 nautical miles (50Â km; 31Â mi) but misidentified it as the French colony of Saint-Domingue on the island of Hispaniola.[28][29] The Zong continued on its westward course, leaving Jamaica behind. This mistake was recognised only after the ship was 300 miles (480Â km) leeward of the island.[28] Overcrowding, malnutrition, accidents and disease had already killed several mariners and approximately 62Â enslaved Africans.[30] James Kelsall later claimed that there was only four days' water remaining on the ship, when the navigational error was discovered and Jamaica was still 10â13 sailing days away.[31]
